acute_aquatic_toxicity.hazard_name: Hazardous to the aquatic environment Acute
acute_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: It was classified into Category 1 from 72 hours ErC50=0.071mg/L of the algae (Selenastrum) (SIDS, 2004).

acute_toxicity_dermal.rationale: Based on the rabbit LD50 (dermal route) value of >7,940mg/kg (SIDS (2004)).

acute_toxicity_inhalation_dust.hazard_name: Acute toxicity Inhalation: Dusts and mists

acute_toxicity_inhalation_gas.rationale: Due to the fact that the substance is "solid" according to the GHS definition and inhalation of its gas is not expected.

acute_toxicity_oral.rationale: Because the rat LD50 (oral route) value of >2,000mg/kg representing the lower of the two testing data, >2,000mg/kg (SIDS (2004)) and >6,310mg/kg (CERI Hazard Data 2001-18 (2002)), is in accordance with OECD TG423, and no evidence of deaths or toxic effects was observed.

chronic_aquatic_toxicity.hazard_name: Hazardous to the aquatic environment Long-term
chronic_aquatic_toxicity.hazard_statement: Very toxic to aquatic life with long lasting effects
chronic_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: Although acute toxicity is Category 1 and bio-accumulation is low (BCF<8 (2-mercaptobenzothiazole), BCF=51(di(benzothiazol-2-yl)persulfide), BCF=16 (tert-butylamine) and BCF=7.5 (benzothiazole)(Existing Chemical Safety Inspections Data, )), since there was no rapidly degrading (the decomposition by BOD: 0%(Existing Chemical Safety Inspections Data)), it was classified into Category 1.

corrosive_to_metals.rationale: Test methods applicable to solid substances are not available

explosives.rationale: Containing no chemical groups with explosive properties

flammable_gases.hazard_name: Flammable gases including chemically unstable gases
flammable_gases.rationale: Classified as "solid" according to GHS definition

flammable_liquids.rationale: Classified as "solid" according to GHS definition

gases_under_pressure.rationale: Classified as "solid" according to GHS definition

germ_cell_mutagenicity.rationale: Based on the absence of data on multi-generation mutagenicity tests and germ cell mutagenicity tests in vivo, and negative data on somatic cell mutagenicity tests in vivo (micronucleus tests), described in NITE Initial Risk Assessment No.22 (2005), CERI Hazard Data 2001-18 (1997), CERI-NITE Hazard Assessment No.22 (2005) and SIDS (2004).

oxidizing_gases.rationale: Classified as "solid" according to GHS definition

oxidizing_liquids.rationale: Classified as "solid" according to GHS definition

oxidizing_solids.rationale: Organic compounds containing no oxygen, fluorine and chlorine

pyrophoric_liquids.rationale: Classified as "solid" according to GHS definition

reproductive_toxicity.rationale: Based on no evidence of adverse effects on reproductive organs of parental animals and on the offspring in repeated dose toxicity and reproductive toxicity combined studies, described in NITE Initial Risk Assessment No.22 (2005), CERI-NITE Hazard Assessment No.22 (2005) and SIDS (2004).

self_heating_substances.rationale: Test methods applicable to liquid substances are not available (melting point: 108degC (Lide, 84th, 2003), test temperature: 140degC).

self_reactive_substances.rationale: Containing no chemical groups with explosive or self-reactive properties

serious_eye_damage_irritation.rationale: Based on the description in the report on rabbit eye irritation tests (SIDS (2004)): "It can be concluded that the substance is essentially non irritating to the eye, though mild irritation was observed."

skin_corrosion_irritation.rationale: Based on the description in the report on rabbit skin irritation tests evaluated according to the Draize scheme (SIDS (2004)): "It can be concluded that the substance is essentially non irritating to the human skin, though only slight irritation was observed." Also based on the description in CERI-NITE Hazard Assessment No.22 (2005): "There is no evidence of skin irritation."

skin_sensitizer.hazard_statement: May cause an allergic skin reaction
skin_sensitizer.rationale: Based on three epidemiological case reports that provide the evidence of skin sensitization in humans (CERI-NITE Hazard Assessment No.22 (2005)). Also based on the description in the report on guinea pig skin sensitization tests performed according to Buehler Method (SIDS (2005)): "Skin sensitization: positive."

substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.hazard_name: Substances and mixtures which, in contact with water, emit flammable gases
substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.rationale: Containing no metals or metalloids (B, Si, P, Ge, As, Se, Sn, Sb, Te, Bi, Po, At)

systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organ toxicity - Repeated exposure
systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.hazard_statement: May cause damage to organs through prolonged or repeated exposure (kidney, blood system, liver)
systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.rationale: Based on the evidence from animal studies including "vacuolar degeneration of the proximal renal tubules and hemolysis" (Report by the Ministry of Health, Labour and Welfare (1997)), "localized or multiple focal necrosis in the liver" (NITE Initial Risk Assessment No.22 (2005)), "histopathological changes in the liver were observed in the highest dose group" (SIDS (2003)). The effects on experimental animals were observed at dosing levels within the guidance value ranges for Category 2.

systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organ toxicity - Single exposure
